dune has long thought to be unadaptable then came the announcement that denis villeneuve would direct a new adaption as part of a two part film as the book was too big to fit into one movie which is true just look at david lynchs version originally supposed to release in december 2020 it was delayed to septemberoctober in 2021 and now we finally have it    the result a cinematic masterpiece i had very few doubts about this movie but i was a bit afraid that it wouldnt live up to my expectations being a huge fan of the books oh but it most certainly did it exceeded my expectations by a mile so much so that i watched it three times in the theater and i would certainly like to again  ive seen some people thinking the movie is boring but this isnt your run of the mill actionadventure flick and its not supposed to be its a faithful adaption of the highest selling scifi novel in paperback  there arent action scenes with quips around every corner however when there is action oh its beautiful duncan idaho carries these action sequences with excellent fight scenes that make you fall in love with his badassery    this is a more serious scifi epic that explores the politics of dune the culture of the fremen and prophecy of the bene gesserit the movie takes its time rightfully to invite you into a rich exciting world with great detail and lore we follow paul atreides through his journey from his home planet caladan into the desert of arrakis as he is thrust into this generation long prophecy alongside his bene gesserit mother the lady jessica who is a real badass and timothée chalamet is fantastic as paul some scenes have been left out from the book but thats to be expected and the cinematography visuals and score in this movie are off the charts this movie needs to be seen in a theater         since this is only part one the movie kind of does end abrubtly but this isnt really a bad thing when you know its only the first part the only problem is you want more and hopefully part two happens please warner bros greenlight part 2  rating 1010
everything about this movie was just magnificent excited for part 2
its boring  lots of landscape with contemplative music and no plot  it made me sleepy
awesome one of the best movies of the last decade

villeneuve definitely knows how to make a real film not an episode of a tv series like most contemporary mainstream films look like of course there are some flaws but the overall result is more than welcome
a cinematic experience of an epic scale see it in imax or dolby atmos

i want to start this by saying how much i love denis villeneuves work from sicario to arrival to prisoners to bladerunner 2049 hes probably one of my favourite modern directors and he has the keen ability to give an audience exactly what they want in 2049 he managed to take the bladerunner story and twist it on its head to keep it fresh and interesting without it feeling like a cash grab for nostalgias sake hes done the same here but in a differant way instead of making some loose mockery of herberts work to promote a musician denis has instead opted to recount the first half of the book almost scene for scene making very little major changes aside from a few casting choices still the casting was great oscar isaac is exactly how i imagined duke leto and paul was similarly well cast the cinematography was excellent and really contrasted well with the brilliant score and the arid backdrop of arrakis this film being part 1 really took its time in establishing the politics leading up to the films midpoint climax that being said there were a number of small minor cons id like to mention    in places the dialogue almost felt too quiet with actors struggling to speak over the admittedly brilliant score this didnt happen enough for it to take me out of the film but it was jarring in places    the casting for gurney and duncan was also strange despite the rest of the casting being great dont get me wrong jason momoa and josh brolin are great actors and play their parts well however i cant help but notice film gurney is way more morose with book gurney with barely an baliset in sight jason momoa was really just playing jason momoa which is fine but some of his dialogue felt too quippy and marvelesque for my tastes    still those are two really minor points in an otherwise amazing adaptation of a scifi classic i recommend both fans of the book and casual film fans to go out and watch this film preferably in imax because it was clearly filmed for imax im giving this film a solid 1010

dune is a scifi epic but nonetheless not the best of his kind it is far better than lynchs version from 1984 but makes many faults too the movie tries to capture the books feeling so hard that the writers forgot how dramaturgy works the main battle which is the climax of this movie takes place in the middle of the movie but after that it doesnt speed up again yet slows down and ends in a moment of silence which doesnt make much sense to me also i would never compare this with the fellowship of the ring it is epic its effects are big but not as monumental as lotr plus i thought the score wasnt that great although it was a heart project by zimmer i might have found this film mediocre because its slower than the usual scifimovies or because of the focus on politics or because of villeneuves style which confused me in sicario as well in the end villeneuve made a decent yet mediocre work of scifi that picks up more and more weights that unfortunately pull this film down to a level that the scale of dune doesnt deserve
great movie great charscters only thing that is bad is that it ends and you need part 2

i dont know how you were able to sit through this movie fanboys of books and fans of the genre probably got high but in general  a game of thrones in the universe of star wars with its own rules which were not explained and conditionalities of which there are too many     imho the creators here sniffed the spice from the desert and went too far with the scale for the sake of history the movie looks very expensive but it doesnt help to get acquainted with the story at all    the neuroticasmaticprotagonist is shown too amorphously although it is clear that already in the second part he is a beast    the fights are well organized they were clearly emphasized but at least the creators could try to explain why the heroes cannot have pistols or assault rifles    got too many questions about universe and almost no answers    i root for hairless dudes even though they will lose    410

the film starts with the main character called something like harry potter and his mum has just caught him dreaming about girls again so being a bit weird she tells all his teachers    mrs mcgonagall turns up and orders harry to stick his hand in her magical box yes really she says he could be the one just in case it might then get mysterious or interesting they cleverly spell out all the story so if anyone watching feels like going to the toilet or going home or something they just can without missing anything at all  neat    harrys dad whos a top general in team america  hell yea gets posted to afghanistan and all the family go with for reason even though they all know its a trap you can figure out for out yourself its a trap if you listen really carefully because admiral ackbar says loudly its a trap and then so does every other character several times to protect the audience from being unpleasantly surprised or interested later on    they go to afghanistan and voldemort turns up  good lord its a trap they have several car chases but harry is best friends with vin diesels character from thefastandthefurious so they get away i missed a bit then as i remembered i had to upload pictures of my cat mr mittens to facebook but fortunately the second hour of the film was just a helicopter flying through a sand storm so there was plenty of time to fit in some hobbies like fermenting sauerkraut etc    there must be a plan for a sequel because they kept the plot for a later date the acting was really great which raises my overall rating of the film up to zero out of one hundred
one of the most boring movies of 2021 the art style was cool but story was boring and very predictable the audience is unable to connect to the characters resulting in a story that is uninteresting

an instant classic and is without a doubt the best adaptation of frank herberts masterpiece the original novel is one of my favorite pieces of fiction ever so the fact that i can call this new adaptation a masterpiece as well makes me happier than anything else now ill just have to patiently wait for part two of this great epic
